summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 25, 2023, between FBI and possibly DOJ personnel discussing the search for a government witness who previously testified as a metadata expert in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The SDNY is seeking this person to serve as an expert in the FTX case and is looking for case precedent.

persons.name: SSA Nem
persons.context: Appears as the sender of the final email in the chain, thanking someone for a response.

persons.name: Steve
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who may have testified as a metadata expert in the Maxwell case and is being considered for the FTX case.

persons.name: SSA Clarke
persons.context: Identified as the case agent for the Maxwell case in an email response.

connections.description: Steve was a potential witness/expert in the Maxwell case for which SSA Clarke was the case agent.

events.title: Email inquiry about Maxwell case expert
events.description: SDNY prosecutors inquire with FBI personnel to identify a government witness who testified as a metadata expert in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, for potential use in the FTX case.

locations: FBI New York Field Office Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking
FBI NY Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking Task Force
keyFacts: The SDNY is seeking a metadata expert witness from the Ghislaine Maxwell case to potentially testify in the FTX case.
SSA Clarke is identified as the case agent for the Maxwell investigation.
The court in the Maxwell case did not allow law enforcement officers to give opinion testimony as experts under Rule 702, though one individual did testify regarding metadata.
The communication shows coordination between the USAO and FBI regarding witness testimony and case precedent.
The emails are dated August 2023, indicating ongoing legal preparations related to the FTX case.
